Comment: In this game I applied Bobby Fischer's bust to the king's gambit. Gambit accepted and pawn defended. As Fischer puts it "Thank you, Weaver Adams!"
Gambit accepted.
Gambit accepted.
Gambit accepted.
This is the variation promoted by Fischer. Not exactly his invention but he studied it well.

According to the variation white should have played 4. h4.
and since he hasn't done so black can defend the pawn.
At this point this move is a bit too late.
I left the king quite open but there was really nothing threatening in the next few moves.
6. d5 was good as it opens up the right side of black but the next moves by white force him into defense.
Black is forced into the defense from the very first few moves.
